moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 c5: I typically play the king's indian, but I thought I would try something different considering that I had access to the gameknot database.
moves.3. Nc3 cxd4 4. Qxd4 Nc6: I liked the idea of exchanging pawns and developing my knight with tempo
moves.5. Qd1 e6 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Bxf6: Not a good echange. For one thing it puts my dark squared bishop on its favorite diagonal. Also, white's kingside remains undeveloped.
moves.7... Bxf6 8. Rc1: Trying to avoid doubled pawns, but I like my bishop too much to trade at this point.
moves.8... O-O: With a good lead in development I decide to secure my king.
moves.9. Ne4: The b2 pawn looks pretty juicy, pluss white's kingside is still undeveloped.
moves.9... Bxb2 10. Rb1 Bd4 11. e3 Bb6: I had thoughts of keeping white's king from castling, but it wasn't to be.
moves.12. Bd3 Ba5+ 13. Nd2 Nb4: Forking the bishop on d3 and the pawn on a2.
moves.14. Qb3: Responds to both threats, but white's queen is tied up to a passive role. My plan is to open things up and develop my light squared bishop.
moves.14... d5 15. Ngf3: perhaps advancing the c pawn was a better idea for white.
moves.15... dxc4 16. Bxc4 b5: I was looking to create a pin of sorts along the b file with my rook, threatening a check/discovered pin winning the bishop.
moves.17. Be2 Bb7: Finally activating the light squared bishop. I have my eye on the a2 pawn.
moves.18. O-O Bd5 19. Qb2 Nxa2: Taking with the knight gave me multiple threats, attacking the knight on d2, and threatening the fork if white responds with Qxb5.
moves.20... Rb8: Even if white moves the queen, the coming Nc3 fork still wins the bishop.
moves.21. Nd4 a6 22. Nc6: Adding insult to injury white gives up his best knight for a weak knight on the edge of the board.
moves.22... Bxc6 23. Qxa2 axb5: I considered pushing this lovely passed pawn, but white cuts it off with his knight.
moves.24. Nb3 Qd5: Threatening mate. I thought this was a little stronger than Qd5 because it adds some pressure to the queenside as well as the mate threat.
Another mate threat with one response.
